derivation: a prolonged form of a primary verb, (used only in an alternate in certain tenses;
kjv_def: be accounted, (of own) please(-ure), be of reputation, seem (good), suppose, think, trow
strongs_def: compare the base of G1166 (δοκέω)) of the same meaning; to think; by implication, to seem (truthfully or uncertainly)
outline:
1. to be of opinion, think, suppose
  2. to seem, to be accounted, reputed
  3. it seems to me
    1. I think, judge: thus in question
    2. it seems good to, pleased me, I determined
